result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J Luoma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence Credit for 63 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.  Refund balance to poster.
Maintain/Obtain full time employment and/or school.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Minimum of two self-help meetings per week.

To have no contact with any known drug users or locations where illegal drugs are stored or sold.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: with Huber-Release for work and treatment.  Last 2 months are STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision. SATISFIED
dated October12, 2015 from Nancy Luoma
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Eric J Luoma in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Counts #2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Defendant's mother makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1
Imposed and stayed Sentence of:
3 1/2 years Imprisonment (If revoked Credit - 63days )
18 months of Initial Confinement
2 Years of Extended Supervision 

Term of Probation: 2 Years
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain/Obtain full time employment and/or school;
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge;
To have no contact with any known drug users or locations where illegal drugs are stored or sold
Minimum of two self-help meetings per week
Condition time:  8 months work and treatment release at HUBER, with the last two months imposed by stayed for the use of the agent
Costs: $268.00 Bail to be applied from case #15CF213
DNA surcharge: $250.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.
